intro: Tetratome latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf tetratome, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural research.
